page.title: 10JUDAISM IN NEWTON MEARNS
page.content:
A large percentage of the Jewish population of Scotland reside in Newton Mearns. There are two synagogues serving the needs of 240 families. There is a Jewish Newspaper called the Jewish Echo, which is printed in Glasgow. Many youth clubs and sports activities are organised for young Jewish people in the area. Both the state and private education systems are used. Employment for adults is in businesses and in the professions.
Bahai : This sect of Judaism has about 30 members in Newton Mearns but as it does not have an established place of worship it is allowed the use of the 18th century Mearns Old Parish Church.
